messages.messageBody:
big fan here! i find them hilarous and insightful, tho i don't listen as often
as i used to. (btw, another non-commercial radio gem is "dead dog cafe comedy
hour"). if you do want to write to click & clack, here's their e-mail.

o http://cartalk.cars.com/Mail/3500.html

> I think this guy needs to hear about unschooling.

--
Jessica Kelly

messages.subject: Click and Clack
messages.msgSnippet: Any Click and Clack (Car Talk) fans here? Well, I just finished reading their (I think) latest book, In Our Humble Opinion : Car Talk s Click and Clack Rant
messages.messageBody:
Any Click and Clack (Car Talk) fans here? Well, I just finished reading their
(I think) latest book, In Our Humble Opinion : Car Talk's Click and Clack
Rant and Rave, and there's a great section on Education. The gist is that
education in this country, from early to late, is done badly. Tom says it
doesn't teach things that are useful, doesn't respect what the kid wants to
know, and doesn't consider learning motivation. He actually mentions a friend
who homeschools his kids as having the right idea.

I think this guy needs to hear about unschooling.

Kathryn





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
